properties.title: Argentina
properties.description: deposit (Source A)
properties.Deposit Amount: $0.40 deposit (Source A)
properties.Containers Covered: PET Bottles (non-refillable excluded) (Source A)

properties.title: Austria
properties.description: voluntary deposit-refund on beverage packaging (AFET)
properties.Recycling Rate: 21% PET reprocessed into new bottles (Van Eygen)

properties.title: Belgium
properties.description: Containers taxed $0.52 per liter unless they have deposit (Source A); An eco-tax of 0.1 €/l on one-way and reusable beverage packaging is charged. This was intended to be refundable on return, however, the return scheme was not installed. (AFET)
properties.Deposit Amount: $0.12 < 50 cl deposit; $0.24 > 50 cl deposit (A)
properties.Containers Covered: Beer, soda, and soft drinks (Source A)

properties.title: Brazil
properties.description: Informal sector (Wen)
properties.Recycling Rate: 55.8% PET Recycling Rate in 2010 (Wen); 54.8% PET Recycling Rate in 2008 (Castro)

properties.title: Canada-Alberta
properties.description: All containers sold in Alberta (including imports) must be registered through the Beverage Container Management Board (BCMB). (Source A)
properties.Containers Covered: All beverage containers regulatory except milk which is under a voluntary scheme. (Source A).
properties.Recollection Rate: Glass (AB Beer) 96% Glass (import beer) 92% Alu (beer) 89% Alu (soft) 79% Overall 78% (Source A)

properties.title: Canada-British Columbia
properties.description: All containers must be refillable, and none collected can be landfilled or incinerated. Beer separate system, though still under legislation (Source A)
properties.Deposit Amount: Non-alcoholic $0.05 <1 l $0.10> 1 ; Alcoholic (not incl. beer) $0.10 < 1 ; $0.20 >1 ; Beer $1.2 per dozen (Source A)
properties.Containers Covered: All beverage containers except milk, soya milk, infant formulas, dietary or meal supplements, or other milk substitutes. (A)

properties.title: Canada-Manitoba
properties.description: Beverage producers given option of setting up deposit-return system, or adding a 2 cent per container levy. Only beer producers choose the former. (Source A)
properties.Deposit Amount: $0.10 (Source A)
properties.Containers Covered: Beer containers only (Source A)
properties.Recollection Rate: Refillable beer 95.5% ; Dom beer 74%; Glass 34% ; Overall residential 31% (Source A)

properties.title: Canada-New Brunswick
properties.description: Deposits paid on all containers (bar milk), but whilst full paid back on refillables, only half paid back on non-refillables. (Source A)
properties.Containers Covered: All except milk (Source A)
properties.Recollection Rate: 96% Refillable Beer; 75% Dom Beer ; 75% Non-alcoholic (Source A)

properties.title: Canada-Newfoundland
properties.description: Half-back system, with manufacturers prohibited from selling containers other than recyclable or refillable for selected products. Beer operated separately, run by brewers. Only have to refund when customer buying (1 for 1), otherwise negotiable. (A)
properties.Deposit Amount: Non-alcoholic $0.08 ($0.04 back) Alcoholic (excluding beer) $0.20 ($0.10 back) Beer varies -full refund when same number of beer bought as empties returned. (A)
properties.Containers Covered: Beverage containers smaller than 5l, excluding milk, dietary supplements and medicine. (Source A)

properties.title: Canada-Northwest Territory
properties.description: Deposit-return system, with additional handling charges for different products/ materials in container. (Source A)
properties.Deposit Amount: Wine or spirit $0.25 Other $0.10 Plus additional $0.05-0.10 handling fee (Source A)
properties.Containers Covered: All beverage containers except milk (Source A)

properties.title: Canada-Novia Scotia
properties.description: Half-back deposit system. Full refund on refillables, half on non-refillables. (Source A)
properties.Deposit Amount: Non-alcoholic $0.10 ; Alc. refillable <1 $0.10 , >1 $0.20 ; Alc. non-refillable <0.5 $0.10, >0.5 $0.20 (Source A)
properties.Containers Covered: All beverage containers except milk (Source A)

properties.title: Canada-Ontario
properties.description: Deposit-return system on alcoholic drinks containers only. Use of ‘Industry Standard Bottle’. (Source A)
properties.Deposit Amount: Containers up to 630 ml, or metal containers up to 1 $0.10 ; Over those sizes $0.20 (Source A)
properties.Containers Covered: Alcoholic drink containers (Source A)

properties.title: Canada-Prince Edward Island
properties.description: Non-refillable drinks containers for beer or soft drinks banned since 1977. Wine may have half-back system in place. (Source A)
properties.Deposit Amount: Non-al <0.5 $0.15; 0.5 -1 $0.30 ; >1 $0.70 ; Alc. $1.20 per dozen, or ).07 each (Source A)
properties.Containers Covered: Soft drinks and alcoholic drinks. Wine may be included. (Source A)

properties.title: Canada-Quebec
properties.description: Return-to-retail deposit system, with industry required to fund kerbside collection for containers not part of the system. (Source A)
properties.Deposit Amount: Soft drinks and beer cans $0.05 ; Beer bottles $0.10 ; Beer bottles and soft drinks >450ml $0.20 (Source A)
properties.Containers Covered: All beer and soft drinks containers (not juice, water and iced tea) (Source A)

properties.title: Canada-Saskatchewan
properties.description: Deposit-return system plus environmental handling charge (EHC) for non- refillable containers, for recycling, and beer bottle deposit system for refillables (Source A)
properties.Deposit Amount: Deposits vary widely for diff. materials and sizes ; Non-ref. glass $0.40-1.00 ; Metal cans $0.10-0.20 (Source A)
properties.Containers Covered: All beverage containers apart from milk (under voluntary system) (Source A)
properties.Legislation: 1973- Litter Control Regulations (unclear, appears the deposit system introduced to this in 1998) (Source A)
properties.Recollection Rate:
Refillable
beer 92% Dom. beer cans 95% Alu. cans 95% Glass 83% Overall 86% (Source A)

properties.title: Canada-Yukon
properties.description: No kerbside collection. Deposit-return system, with ‘recycling club’ for children offering ‘prizes’ as well as refund if certain numbers reached. Refillables not charged recycling fund fee, all others are. (Source A)
properties.Deposit Amount: D=deposit, R=refund Liquor ref. D=$0.10 R=$0.10 ; Liquor non <0.5 D=$0.15 R=$0.10 ; >0.5 D=$0.35 R=$0.25 (Source A)
properties.Containers Covered: All beverage containers except milk (Source A)
properties.Recollection Rate: Refillable bottles 103% ' Non-refill. bottles 113% (?) ; Liquor containers <200ml 99%, 1L 90%, >1L 79% (includes refillables) (Source A)

properties.title: China
properties.description: Informal system of collectors (Kuo) ; 2006 plan for the construction of Recyclables' Collection System etc (See google docs) (Kuo)

properties.title: Croatia
properties.description: Deposit-return plus "incentive fee" to be paid by producerif 50% refill isn't met (5% paid still, if target is met) A
properties.Containers Covered: Glass, PET and metal containers for beer, soft drinks, water, wine, and spirits (A)

properties.title: Cyrpus
properties.description: Deposit-return system for reusable containers, with legal provisions--the only voluntary deposit on beer glass bottle may end in future (AFET)

properties.title: Czech Republic
properties.description: deposit-return system for reusable containers w/ legal provisions (AFET)

properties.title: Denmark
properties.description: All beers and soft drinks must be sold in refillable bottles & deposit (Source A); deposit-refund
properties.Deposit Amount: €0.13 Type A – Cans, plastic and glass bottles <0.5; €0.20 Type B – Plastic bottles @0.5; €0.40 Type C – Cans, plastic and glass bottles >0.5 (Source A)
properties.Containers Covered: Imported glass/plastic containers (Source A)
properties.Legislation: Packaging Law, Regulatory Deposit, Ecotax of 1989 (and amended 1991) (Source A)

properties.title: Estonia
properties.description: Deposit-return at retailers (Source A); deposit-refund system on beverage packaging voluntary reusable containers, mandatory one-way containers, if the target is not met excise duty paid (AFET)
properties.Deposit Amount: Glass 1.0 kroon (refill and NRB) Metal and PET < 0.5; 0.5 kroons; PET>0.5 1kroon (Source A)
properties.Containers Covered: Beer, low alcohol drinks, carbonated/non-carbonated soft drinks, water, juice, cider, and perry (A)

properties.title: Federal States of Mircronesia
properties.description: Kosrae Recycling Program & Deposit-Return (Source A)
properties.Deposit Amount: $0.06 ($0.05 back) (Source A)
properties.Containers Covered: aluminum cans only; glass & plastic expected soon (Source A)

properties.title: Finland
properties.description: Tax on beverage containers. Excemption from tax only if part of refilalble deposit scheme (Source A); 2004 Beverage Packaging Tax--until 2005 only refillable bottles exempt if in deposit system, 2008 one-way exempt (Ettlinger); Deposit refund system since 1950 w/ glass, 2008 one-way bottles, reverse vending machine, EUR 0.51 per litre for all drinks packaging not in deposit (Ettlinger); aluminum cans, PET, glass (Kuo); consumers takes to shops, kiosks, hotels, restaurants, offices, schools, and other organizations return (Kuo); resuable containers deposit with legal provisions, one-way voluntary, The Finish industry "voluntarily" chose to implement a deposit system to avoid a packaging tax. (AFET)
properties.Deposit Amount: Non-refillables: €0.15 cans; €0.10 plastic bottles <0.35; €0.20 plastic bottles 0.35-1; €0.40 plastic bottles >1; Tax $0.24 beer $0.47 plastic $0.71 glass (A); EUR 0.10 all glass bottles (Ettlinger)
properties.Containers Covered: One-way beer and soft drink containers
properties.Recollection Rate: 99% Glass Bottles; 86% Cans (A); One-way packing 89-95% in 2015 (Ettlinger); 96% can, 92% PET bottle, 88% glass bottle in 2018 (Kuo)

properties.title: Germany
properties.description: Einwegpfand Deposit on one-way a standard amount, deposit on refillables manufacturer dependent, not legally specified, though tend to be similar (A); Recycle and Waste Material Control Act of 2003 (Hsiao); reusable with legal provisions, one-way mandatory deposit (AFET)
properties.Deposit Amount: For one-way: ≤1.5 €0.25; >1.5 €0.50 (Source A); uniform deposit amount of 25 cents on all one-way containers, whereas for multi-way (such as glass bottles or multi-way PET containers) it is usually 8 cents (STRACKE)
properties.Containers Covered: Not containers for wine, fruit juice, or spirits (Source A)
properties.Legislation: 2003 (Source A); 1991 Verpackungsverordnung (short VerpackV packaging regulation) , 2003 nationwide bottle-despoit-refund-service (Stracke)
properties.Bottles Consumed: 590 10^3 metric tons of total plastic in 2002 (Hsiao)
properties.Recollection Rate: Quota: Glass 90%, Aluminum 90%, Plastic 80% (Source A); 93.5% PET Recollection Rate in 2011 (Welle)

properties.title: Hungary
properties.description: Tax linked to market share quotas (Source A)
properties.Containers Covered: Beer, low-alcohol drinks, wine, mineral water, carbonated and non-carbonated soft drinks (Source A)
properties.Recollection Rate: Quota: Beer 67%, Low Alcohol 28%, Wine 20% (Source A)

properties.title: Iceland
properties.description: Tax on non-refillable containers (Source A)
properties.Containers Covered: Non-refillable glass, steel, aluminum, and plastic (Source A)

properties.title: Japan
properties.description: "The Containers and Packaging Recycling Law" (Wen); 1995 Law for Promotion of Sorted Collection & Recycling of Containers & Packaging (Amano); general taxes to establish a waste governance system resting on consumers’ responsibility (Takahashi); curbside collection with some consumer responsibility ( Takahashi)
properties.Bottles Consumed: 595 of 1000 tons in 2010 (Wen); 160 of 10^3 metric tons in 2002 (Hsiao)
properties.Recollection Rate: 77.9% PET plastic bottles recollection rate in 2008 (Welle)
properties.Recycling Rate: 72.1% PET recycling rate in 2010 (Wen); 69.2% PET Recycling Rate of 2007 (Castro)

properties.title: Latvia
properties.description: Deposit-refund system on beverage packaging with legal provisions--reusable containers (AFET)

properties.title: Lithuania
properties.description: Deposit-refund system on beverage packaging with legal provisions--reusable containers (AFET)

properties.title: Malta
properties.description: Deposit return system; previous ban of non-glass beverage containers lifted (Source A)

properties.title: Mexico
properties.description: Higher tax on non-refillable bottles and cans (Source A)
properties.Legislation: Management Plan for PET Packaging Waste est. 2002 (Shwanse)
properties.Bottles Consumed: 465,000 consumed (ECOCE); 790,000 PET water bottles total in 2009 (Schwanse)

properties.title: Netherlands
properties.description: Agreement deposit (Source A); There are voluntary systems for glass beer bottles and large PET bottles (reusable and one-way). The main instrument is a packaging tax. (AFET)
properties.Deposit Amount: PET and glass: $0.16 <0.5 & $0.72>0.5 (Source A)
properties.Containers Covered: Soft drinks and water in one-way and refillable glass and PET containers (Source A)
properties.Recollection Rate: 98% Refillable glass & 99% PET (Source A); For PET deposit bottles, a return rate of 95% is reported, compared to 66% of non-deposit PET bottles. (AFET)

properties.title: Norway
properties.description: Deposit on containers and tax dependent on return rate. Refillables only exempt if 95% return rate is achieved. Retailers (on site >25m2) selling non- refillables, must also sell similar products in refillable.(A); deposit-refund system on beverage packaging mandatory for one-way containers (AFET)
properties.Deposit Amount: $0.16 <0.5 & $0.40 >0.5 l (+Tax inversely proportional to return rate, but if above 95%, no tax) (A)
properties.Containers Covered: Most drinks, excluding milk, vegetable juices, and water (Source A)

properties.title: Peru
properties.description: Deposit on some bottles (Source A)
properties.Containers Covered: 620 ml size beer bottles (Source A)

properties.title: Poland
properties.description: Deposit-refund system on beverage packaging voluntary for reusable containers (AFET)

properties.title: Portugal
properties.description: Fillers must ensure quotas met. Retailers must sell refillables for all non-refillables sold. (Source A); Packaging Waste Target of 70%, Plastic Packaging Waste Target of 42% (Freitas)
properties.Containers Covered: Quotas: 80% Beer, 65% Wine (with some exceptions), 30% Soft-drinks (Source A)
properties.Recycling Rate: total plastic packaging recycling rate 42% in 2016 (Freitas)

properties.title: Slovakia
properties.description: Deposit-refund system on beverage packaging for reusable containers, legal provisions, one-way containers mandatory (AFET)
properties.Deposit Amount: The deposit on one-way packing is zero (0) € (AFET)

properties.title: Slovenia
properties.description: Deposit-refund on beverage packaging for resusable containers legal provisions, Reusable packaging is exempt from waste management levy and environmental tax. Voluntary deposit on reusable glass. (AFET)

properties.title: South Africa
properties.description: Voluntary deposit return system (manufactuer driven not government) (Source A)
properties.Deposit Amount: Between 8-15% of product cost (or 0.5-1% if wine/spirit) (Source A)
properties.Containers Covered: Beer, soft drinks, some wine & spirits bottles (Source A)

properties.title: South Australia
properties.description: Container Deposit Legislation- deposit required on almost all drinks containers, with onus on manufacturer/ wholesaler to ensure convenient system in place for deposit of container/ refunds for customers. (A)
properties.Deposit Amount: $0.10 if refillable to retailer (rare) $0.05 if refillable to collection depot (99.9% done this way) (Source A)
properties.Containers Covered: Most included except wine (unless in plastic bottle), milk, pure fruit juice or flavoured milk >1l.(Source A)
properties.Legislation: 1975 (integrated into Environment Protection Act in 1993) (Source A)
properties.Recollection Rate: 85% non- refillable glass 84% cans 74% PET (Source A)

properties.title: Spain
properties.description: If recovery/recycling targets are not met a tax applies. (AFET)
properties.Recollection Rate: 57% Reuse beer, 87% overall (Source A); 39.2% PET plastic recollection rate in 2011 (Welle)

properties.title: Sweden
properties.description: Law requires rate of 90% recycling of aluminum cans, or complete bans. Industry implemented deposit system to avoid this. PET deposit introduced later. (Source A); open-loop recycling for plastic packaging, closed-loop recycling for PET bottles (Freitas), PET bottle recycling target 90% (Freitas); 2 types of beverage container returns: refillable glass bottles & metal/PET run by 3 companies (Kuo); Ordinance on the return system for plastic bottles and plastic cans (SFS 2005:220), regulation on producer responsibility for packaging (SFS 2006:1273) (Kuo); Deposit-refund system on beverage packaging voluntary for reusable containers, mandatory for one-way containers (AFET)
properties.Deposit Amount: Voluntary Cans $0.07, Refillable PET $0.56, & One-way PET $0.14- 0.24 (Source A); 1 Swedish Krona (SEK) for aluminium cans as well as for PET bottles up to 1L, and 2 SEK for PET bottles over 1L (STRACKE)
properties.Containers Covered: Most beverage containers (Source A)
properties.Legislation: Act on Certain Beverage Containers of 1991, The Ordinance on Producer’s Responsibility for Packaging of 1994 (Amano); Deposit on one-way containers- 1984 for cans. 1994 for PET (refillables already in place) (A); Act on Certain Beverage Containers of 1991-Amended 1993-Require fillers of PET bottles to participate in a recycling system and mark container accordingly-2005: separate laws for aluminum and PET merged-1984--Swedish gov’t requires industry to recycle at least 90% of aluminum cans to avoid general ban (STRACKE)
properties.Bottles Consumed: 160 million bottles sold (Refillable) in 1991 & 200 million bottles sold (one-way) in 1994 (Amano); Deposit on one-way containers- 1984 for cans. 1994 for PET (refillables already in place) (A); 2169 million beverage containers sold (Kuo)
properties.Recycling Rate: 98% Refillable 2004; 79% One-way 2004 (Amano); total plastic packaging recycling 50% in 2016, PET bottles 82% in 2016, plastic packaging 47% in 2016 (Freitas); 85.7% metal cans, 84.1% PET bottles (Kuo)

properties.title: Switzerland
properties.description: Deposits required on all refillable drinks containers except cans, which have a voluntary tax of $0.04 (Source A)
properties.Deposit Amount: Ref. glass $0.16<0.6; $0.40 >0.6; Ref and one-way PET $0.40>1.5 (Source A)
properties.Containers Covered: Currently all containers (Source A)
properties.Recollection Rate: 85% PET collection rate (Van Eygen); 45% Closed-loop PET in 2012, 31% open-loop in 2012 (Haupt)
properties.Recycling Rate: 26% Reprocessed into new bottles (Van Eygen); 26% Closed-loop PET recycling in 2012, 30% open-loop recycling in 2012 (Haupt)

properties.title: Taiwan
properties.description: 1989 recycling program modelled afterr Germany's DSD--manufacturers and retailors pay disposal fees to gov't who recycles through local gov't help (Hsiao)
properties.Legislation: "Solid Waste Disposal Act" of 1988: "Hsi-Fu Recycling Project" (Yang); Waste Disposal Act (Hsiao)
properties.Bottles Consumed: 60 million pcs. generated or 11,000 metric tons (1990) Yang; 4.56 of 10^3 metric tons 2002 (Hsiao)

properties.title: United Kingdom-Scotland
properties.description: Voluntary deposit refund on reusable beverage packaging exists only in Scotland--voluntary for reusable containers (AFET)

properties.title: USA (total)
properties.description: No nationwide law, 11 statewide laws with deposit-return (Wen); 3/11 state laws include PET water bottles (Container Recycling Institute); 3 methods (curbside collection, buy-back recycling centers. bottle bills) (Wen)
properties.Recollection Rate: 28.2% in 2011 (Welle); 26% PET Bottle Collection Rate in 2008, 15-16% Overall PET Collection (Kuczenski)
properties.Recycling Rate: 29.1% PET Recycling in 2010 (Wen); 27% PET Recycling Rate in 2007 (Castro)

properties.title: USA-California
properties.description: California Beverage Container Recycling and Litter Reduction Act, Deposit-return system on non-refillable containers (Source A)
properties.Deposit Amount: Under 24oz $0.05 ; Over 24oz $0.10 (Source A)
properties.Containers Covered: Non-refillable drinks containers, inc. beer, spirits, carbonated, fruit drinks and some vegetable juices. Not milk. (Source A)
properties.Legislation: 1987 (Expanded 2000 to include all non- carbonated and non- alcoholic drinks excluding milk.) (Source A)
properties.Recollection Rate: Alu 73% Glass 58% PET 46% HDPE 51% Overall 61% (Source A)

properties.title: USA-Connecticut
properties.description: Beverage Container Deposit and Redemption Law Deposit-return system. (Source A)
properties.Deposit Amount: $0.05 (Source A)
properties.Containers Covered: Beer, malt, soft drinks, and mineral water (Source A)
properties.Recollection Rate: Not recorded. In 2004 CRI estimated recycling rate to be similar to Massachuset ts of 69% (Source A)

properties.title: USA-Delaware
properties.description: Beverage Container Legislation Deposit-return system (Source A)
properties.Deposit Amount: $0.05 (Source A)
properties.Containers Covered: All non-aluminium beer, malt, carbonated, mineral water and soda water containers less than 2 quarts (approx. 1.9l). (Source A)

properties.title: USA-Hawaii
properties.description: Deposit Beverage Container Law Deposit-Return System (Source A)
properties.Deposit Amount: $0.05 (Source A)
properties.Containers Covered: All beverage containers excluding milk and dairy derived products, except tea and coffee or liquor containers. (Source A)

properties.title: USA-Iowa
properties.description: Beverage Container Deposit Law, Deposit Return-System. Deposit containers banned from landfill in 1990. (Source A)
properties.Deposit Amount: Not less than $0.05 (Source A)
properties.Containers Covered: Beer, soft drinks, soda water, mineral water, wine, liquor and wine, coolers. (Source A)

properties.title: USA-Maine
properties.description: Refillable Beverage Container Law Deposit-return system (Source A)
properties.Deposit Amount: $0.15, Other $0.05 (Source A)
properties.Containers Covered: cooler, mineral water. Expanded to include wine, liquor, water and non-alcoholic drinks in 1989 (Source A)

properties.title: USA-Masachusetts
properties.description: Beverage Container Recovery Law Depsoit-return system (Source A)
properties.Deposit Amount: $0.05 (Source A)
properties.Containers Covered: Beer, soft drinks, and carbonated wtaer (Source A)

properties.title: USA-Michigan
properties.description: MIchigan Beverage Container Act , Deposit-return system (Source A)
properties.Deposit Amount: $0.10 (Source A)
properties.Containers Covered: Beer, soft drinks, carbonated and mineral water. Wine coolers and canned cocktails in 1988. (Source A)

properties.title: USA-New York
properties.description: New York Refillable Container Law; Deposit-return system (Source A)
properties.Deposit Amount: Minimum of $0.05 (Source A)
properties.Containers Covered: Beer and other malt drinks, carbonated soft drinks, wine coolers, mineral and soda waters. (Source A)
properties.Recollection Rate: Soft drink 62% Beer 77% Wine coolers 65% Overall 70% (Source A)

properties.title: USA-Oregon
properties.description: The Beverage Container Act; Deposit-return system; Only US deposit law with no handling fee (Source A)
properties.Deposit Amount: Standardized refill bottles $0.02 Non-standardized and non-refillable $0.05 (Source A)
properties.Containers Covered: Beer, malt, carbonated soft drinks, mineral and soda water and (as of 2009) water and flavoured water. Bottles and cans under 3L (Source A)

properties.title: USA-Vermont
properties.description: Beverage Container Law; Depsoit-return system (Source A)
properties.Deposit Amount: Liquor above 50ml $0.15 Other $0.05 (Source A)
properties.Containers Covered: Beer, soft drinks, malt, soda and mineral water, mixed wine and liquor (added 1987). (Source A)
